title: What is the advantage of disabling the Window's Firewall? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your network administrator is most likely running a physical firewall appliance such as a Cisco, adtran, juniper, etc. And some form of Anti-virus, Anti-Malware software that he prefers which allows him to have more control over the entire network. The advantage for the administrator is it is easier to apply policies for the entire high School from one portal as apposed to changing the policies / settings on each workstation. There are some other advantages but I am sure your school has simply chosen to use something they believe is more effective that Windows built in firewall. It is actually very common.

There is no specific ADVANTAGE of disabling this feature actually as it’s purpose is to block the incoming unauthorized packets which is a good thing regarding the security. But, the limitation of this feature is that you cannot even ‘ping’ that particular PC and this might be sometime troublesome to IT technician who needs to check the live workstations or perform RDP. So, disabling this feature will let us perform the above mentioned activities which can be stated as an advantage in a sense.
